fields.descriptive_line: Boxed set of sixty colour prints, Macmillan's History Class Pictures Set 1, England, 1951
fields.physical_description:
Dark red portfolio holding sixty colour printed sheets, inside a green paper folder.
[1.	Norman Ships, 11th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting three striped ships landing on a beach, with Norman soldiers, wearing short tunics and with dark bob haircuts, arming themselves with spears and shields. The style is quite painterly, with textures of rocks, sand and water represented by using dry paint and possibly chalk. Figures in teh distance are simpler and mainly in outline. There is black tape folded around the edges of the sheet, which was added at a later date, and pinholes in the corners.
[2.	Norman Warriors, 11th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting an army of Norman soldiers on a beach, wearing chain mail. They hold swords, spears and shields, one is mounted on a white horse, which is tossing its head. The style is quite realist, in clear detail over the chain mail and quivers of arrows. There is black tape folded around the edges of the sheet, which was added at a later date, and pinholes in the corners.
[3.	A Reconstruction of Fountains Abbey, 12th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a bird's-eye view of a ealry Gothic Abbey, set in a bright green countryside. There are cos in the nearby field, and figures wearing white habits. The Abbey is intricately detailed, with grey stonework delineated in black lines. A caption states that the illustration is based on a drawing in 'A History of Architecture' by Sir Banister Fletcher. 
[4.	The Naming of St John the Baptist, 12th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a woman with a baby in bed, attended by a large group of men. The illustration references fourteenth century religious painting, with a flat background of dark blue and green, and characters of an early Renaissance type, wearing triangular-folded draperies. Overall, the colours are bright in shades of orange, red and brown. There is limited modelling and forms are shown in outline. Three characters hold scrolls with Latin inscriptions, and a sense of narrative is created from the gestures and eye contact of the various characters.
[5.	The Investiture of a Priest, 12th C.] Colour print with plain border, in portrait orientation, depicting an altar, a bishop, a kneeling priest and a group of observers. The scene takes place in a Romanesque church with grey stone walls, punctuated by brightly painted columns and arches. The three central figures wear bright draperies of green and yellow, and all figures have the graceful hands and almond-shaped eyes of early Renaissance painting.
[6.	Three Famous Effigies, 12th C.] Colour print with plain border, in portrait orientation, depicting birds-eye-views of three tomb effigies. Henry III appears in bright pink robes with a gold crowna nd sword beside him. Eleanor of Aquitaine wears a white and gold dress, dark blue wrap and gold crown. Richard I wears bright blue and red. Their names are printed below each figure.
[7.	An English Village in Early Norman Times] Colour print with plain border, depicting a birds-eye-view of a village, encircled by a river, traversed by a road, and enclosed by hills and farmland. The landscape is simply depicted, with fields of uniform colour and texture representing different stages of crop rotation. There are a number of labels across the image, indicating features like 'gardens', 'manor', 'dovecote' and 'willow for fences'.
[8.	King Henry II, Archbishop Becket and some Knights, 12th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting the king seated on the left, frowning upwards at the bishop. There are four knights, in chain mail, standing behind him.
The illustration references fourteenth century religious painting, with a flat background of dark blue with gold stars, and characters of an early Renaissance type, wearing triangular-folded draperies. There is a checked floor, creating some depth, and an arch of brightly painted stone in the background. There is limited modelling and forms are shown in outline. There is a strong sense of drama, created by the expressions and gestures of the various characters.
[9.	A Norman Castle, 12th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a motte and bailey castle. The square Norman keep stands on top of a mound, surrounded by wooden buildings, livestock and workers. Beyond the ditch and drawbridge is a hilly landscape with a river and a village centred round a church. The style is quite loose, with textured brush strokes representing the stonework of the castle and its defences. However, small details are clearly shown, such as the armour on horses and beehives in the garden. Black tape has been folded around the edges of the sheet. 
[10.	A Friar and some Pilgrims, 13th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a friar in dark grey habit, standing on the base of a stone cross. His arms are held wide, as he gestures to a small crowd of men with pilgrim's staffs. They all wear subdued colours, and the shadows are deeply modelled with washes of violet and black. In the distance, past two soldiers on horseback, across a round green and chalky landscape, is a cathedral with a tall spire and two square towers.
[11.	A Scribe, 13th C.] Colour print with plain border, in portrait orientation, depicting two tonsured figures in a library, in front of a leaded Gothic window. The seated monk bends over a writing slope, holding a quill pen. the standing monk, behind him, reads from a completed manuscript. On either side of the window are shelves of leather-bound books, each one with a metal chain. The colours are soft, with diffuse light through the room. The atmosphere is intense as each figure is oriented around the writing on the small sheets of vellum.
[12.	Sir Richard Vernon and a Crusading Knight, 15th and 13th C.] Colour print with plain border, in portrait orientation. There are two sections. The left side depicts a tomb effigy of Richard Vernon, wearing a full suit of armour, in colour. On the right, is a depiction of a Maltese Knight, kneeling and raising his hands. There is a helmet above him, and he holds a lance. Both images appear to be copies of stone monuments, enlivened through colour.
[13.	A Water-mill, 13th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a merchant leading a dapple grey pony away from a water mill, laden with sacks. In the doorway of the solid stone mill stands a ruddy-cheeked miller, wearing a red shirt and white apron. The water mill, on the right, is depicted in clear detail. Brown tape has been folded around the edges of the sheet.
[14.	A Doctor Extracting an Arrow-head, 13th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a four men in a stone room, with straw on the floor. The doctor, wearing red and blue draperies, sits on an upholstered ottoman. He is pulling a broken section of arrow out of his patient's back using large metal forceps. The patient, bare to the waist, is bent over on the floor, grimacing and gripping onto the doctor's ankle. There is bright red blood around the wound and splattered nearby. Behind two concerned assistants there are shelves of medical equipment, scales, jugs, and plants.
[15.	A Hunting Party at a Monastery Gate, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a large group outside a stone archway. At the centre is a noblewoman seated sidesaddle on a white horse, being served by a man on a large bay horse. A monk with a thick grey beard stands between them holding a tray of jugs and goblets. Behind, a boy and another monk carry wicker baskets of provisions. There are several dogs in the scene, which is generally bright, colourful and celebratory.
[16.	Pilgrims Returning from Canterbury, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group of seven pilgrims on horseback, riding away from Canterbury in the distance. The group is comprised of men and women of varying occupation and status, including a young monk playing the bagpipes. The painterly image is very light, the landscape wide and flat, punctuated by large trees and two children waving in the middle-distance.
[17.	Country People in the Middle Ages – A] Colour print with plain border, depicting five people in a verdant landscape, pursuing various activities. A man and a woman the foreground are using a double-ended saw to cut a log; two women are using a net and a ferret to flush rabbits out of a warren, and a man with a sling shot, standing in a newly sewn field, is catapulting stones at two crows The background is a forest of rich greens, and a large expanse of blue sky.
[18.	Country People in the Middle Ages – B] Colour print with plain border, depicting three figures in an enclosed area of grass. A woman in the foreground, wearing a light blue smock with white apron and headscarf, feeds a leashed hen and a brood of chicks. Behind her, and man wearing brown and orange sharpens a scythe. An old man, bent under the weight of a basket on his back, walks up the path from the right. 
[19.	Ladies and their Sons, 14th and 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting two interior scenes. On the left, a woman sits opposite a teenage boy in a window alcove. They are playing chequers, while a dog gnaws a bone in the foreground. On the right hand side, a richly dressed woman sits on a large wooden chair, and reads to a young boy standing nearby. The floor is tiled and there is a strip of bright blue decoration above the windows.
[20.	Children Playing Hoodman Blind, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group of five children playing in the street of a Medieval town. The boy in the middle is wearing a hood which covers his face, the other children hold knotted cloths which they appear to be swinging at him. In the background is a thatched cottage, an ox and cart, and the steeple of a church. The colours are sombre, with deep shadows and black outlines around forms.
[21.	Fun at a fair, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a crowded row of stalls outside the gates to a castle. The colourful crowd of people includes acrobats, musicians, a stiltwalker, adults and children, and a trained bear. The figures are all wearing medieval costume, and the scene is set against high stone walls.
[22.	A Windmill and a Treadmill, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a rural scene with a number of figures. On the left, a donkey inside a treadmill draws water from a well. Two women carry buckets nearby. In the centre, a man on a horse, holding a whip and carrying a hessian sack, speaks to two people cutting crops in the field. Behind, a man carries another sack into a small windmill with red sails, raised on stilts.
[23.	Boy’s Sports in the Middle Ages] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group of boys in the grounds of a Medieval castle, being watched by adults and younger children. The sports include fighting with wooden poles, wrestling, and jousting while riding a wooden horse. The castle in the background is of white stone, with dark blue pointed roofs. It is set in a gently rolling parkland crossed with tracks.
[24.	Busy Cooks in a Castle Kitchen, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a large open room, with two wide hearths full of cauldrons and spits, either side of an open door and high glazed window. In the foreground on the left, men and children prepare dishes of meat, rabbit, and vegetables. All around teh table are abskets of food. On the right, a narrow table holds steaming dishes, which are being collected by young boys in matching blue-green liveries, and carried away to the right.
[25.	Illuminations by Scribes – A] Set of four illustrations, arranged on a single portrait sheet. Top left is an illuminated A, with a monk, a knight and a man holding a spade. Top right is an E, peopled by five musicians performing in harmony. Bottom left, an A encloses a king and a knight exchanging a document, and on the bottom right, and king rides with his hounds to hunt a grey stag. The style of the pictures is very simple and linear, with flat fields of colour reminiscent of Medieval manuscripts.
[26.	Illuminations by Scribes – B] Set of four illustrations, arranged on a single portrait sheet. Top left is an illuminated O, with a group of boys playing musical instruments. Top right is an M, behind a winged angel spearing a roaring demon. Bottom left, David stands on the fallen Goliath within the shape on an F, and on the bottom right, four children stand calmly within an O. The style of the pictures is very simple and linear, with flat fields of colour reminiscent of Medieval manuscripts.
[27.	Wayfarers, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a family group approaching a thatched cottage. The wayfarers are led by a man with torn and patched clothes, holding a dog on a chain who holds a begging bowl in his mouth. The baby in a basket wears the same distinctive black hat as the leading adult. There follows a man holding two babies in a basket, an older man, and then a woman carrying another baby. The woman greeting the group is standing outside her house operating a churn.
[28.	A ‘Good Pull-up’ for Wayfarers, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting two wayfarers. One, a man with long hair and beard, sits on a wooden seat at the side of the road and rinks from a wooden bowl. Another, in a short green tunic, walks along with a puppy. Behind, a young girl stands proudly holding a jug.
[29.	John Ball Preaching, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting the meetinf John Ball and Wat Tyler before the Peasants Revolt of 1381. There are two armies, each bearing flags of St George and of their leaders. In the background is a large cathedral, representing a city. This image has been taken from a French illuminated manuscript of the 15th Century, held now at the British Library.

[30.	Spinning, Carding and Weaving in a Lady’s Bower, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a large room with beautifully painted walls and a rush carpeted floor. Three women sit working, carding, spinning and weaving wool. Another woman stands by the hearth, where a baby lies in a rocking cradle, tightly tucked in. The room has two large windows, a high wooden ceiling and an imposing fireplace.
[31.	Shooting with the Long Bow, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group of four men in tights and tunics, shooting at two targets at the other side of the field. The landscape is farmland, with a man pulling a horse and plough in the distance. a river runs by on the left. the trees have no leaves and the sky is grey, creating an autumnal ambience.
[32.	Nuns Waiting on Patients in a Hospital, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting two interior scenes. On the left, a nun bends to put food on the table for two men who appear frail, and who look heavenwards. They are seated on a low carpeted dias on a wooden pew. On the right, a nun feeds a man who is lying in bed. Five beds can be seen in the room, all with bright red blankets over white sheets. The walls in both scenes are bare stone, with high ceilings.
[33.	Ploughing and Harvesting, 14th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting two panoramic views. At the top, four oxen pull a plough through the dark, lumpen earth, while crows circle overhead. Underneath, a crowd of workers cuts and gathers the crop. There is a great contrast between the colours and composition of the two images, reinforcing the opposition of their subject.
[34.	A Market Hall, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting an arcaded room, with a long table in the centre, with many people gathered around buying and selling goods. A couple on the left are looking at tableware, two boys in the foreground are playing with a spinning top, and a man on the far left negotiates with a cobbler.
[35.	Inside and Outside a Town Gate, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, in portrait orientation, depicting an urban scene around a town gate. Inside, the citizens are walking in groups, one man has a hawk and a group on a stage are performing a presentation. Outside, tradespeople have stalls of fish and medicine. The scene is rich and detailed, with figures outlined in black and faces quite caricatured.
[36.	A Sea-fight, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting two large galleon ships encountering and fighting each other. The crews are engaging in hand-to-hand combat, many are wearing armour. Weapons include large boulder dropped from above, longbows and crossbows. Another ship approaches in the distance. The picture has a very still atmosphere; the sea is calm and only one arrow has been fired.
[37.	Pages Tilting at the Quintain, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a young man on a white horse, charging towards a target. The horse is galloping, with all four feet off the ground and saliva splattering from its mouth. Five other youths watch, their horses tossing their heads. In the background, a grey stone castle with pointed turrets has a balcony of watching women. 
[38.	Knights Tilting, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting two knights, one in red the other in blue, fighting with lances. The knights and teh horses are dressed in elaborate armour and draperies. The red knight appears to have landed a blow to the other's neck. In the background is a large marquee of noblemen and women watching, surrounded by crowds and more tents, with a castle on the left.
[39.	The Lady of the Tournament Delivering the Prize, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, in portrait orientation, depicting a large group of people gathered for a presentation. On the left, attendants hold flaming torches, and on the right a noblewoman holds a trophy in the form of a plumed helmet. The hall has a checked floor and dark blue walls with gilded floral decoration.
[40.	Peasants reporting for Work, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, in portrait orientation, depicting a group of medieval labourers in a large hall. They stand with hands raised, holding a variety of farming tools such as scythes and spades. On the left, a man dressed in red sits at a desk on a raised platform, in front of a large green leather book. The hall has windows and tiling resembling the Perpendicular Gothic style.
[41.	Cannon in use at a Siege, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a castle on fire in the middle of a lake. In the foreground, a group of soldiers in armour prepare crossbows and cannon. A ship near the castle attacks from the left, and a group of knights on horseback attack from the right. The countryside is bright green, with a rocky outcrop in the foreground. The style is bright and slightly fantastical, with exaggerated poses and very few shadows.
[42.	A Bedroom Scene, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting an interior scene with three figures. The room is cosy, with a wooden fllor, large stone hearth on the left and a sideboard on the right holding jugs and cookware. A woman sits cooking and reading on the left, and anotehr hodl a plate on the right, looking towards the back of the room where an old man lies on a long bench under a blanket.
[43.	a Lady’s Bower, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group of women sitting in a richly decorated bedroom. The walls are hung with brightly coloured heraldic tapestries, and there is a large bed with a purple canopy and hangings. Six women sit in a semi-circle, with another holding a book and kneeling in the centre. They are all dressed in bright colours and elaborate head dresses. A black cat sits on the left hand side.
[44.	Ladies Dining, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a dining hall in a Renaissance castle. At the centre is a table laden with cakes and tablewares, behind which sit three richly dressed women. There is a table of men on the right. Waiters bring trays of pies and small birds to the table. The room is bright and busy; three musicians play on a balcony and dogs sit under the tables.
[45.	Building for a Lady. 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a large group of labourers working on a building site. A women in a fur-trimmed dress walks through the centre of the image, indicating instructions. 
[46.	Monks at their Devotions, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a high angle view of a service in a monastery chapel. Three pews of tonsured monks observe a trio in red vestments saying mass. 
[47.	The Apple Harvest, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a village scene during the apple harvest. The orchard is on the left, where two children climb the trees to pick apples and scare away birds. A group on the ground gather the fallen fruit. On the other side of a dry winding lane, villagers rush to stop a large pig from eating the baskets of apples. 
[48.	A Gentleman Travelling in a Litter, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a procession through a town. Two white horses carry an old man, dressed in red, in a draped carriage, past crowds of people. They pass a terrace of houses and are approaching a monastery.
[49.	Boats on an Inland Waterway, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting three boats on a rover. In the foreground, a barge with red sails and a four-man crew is pushed along with poles. Two men on the bank pull another boat along with ropes. The boats are loaded with crates of goods.
[50.	Earl Rivers Presenting his Book to King Edward IV, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a royal group, enthroned, accepting the gift of a book from two kneeling men on the left. These men represent Anthony Woodville, 2nd Earl Rivers, and William Caxton, the author and printer, respectively, of the first book to be printed in Britain. They are presenting it to the King, the Queen, and Price Edward.
The image is a version of a much-reproduced representation of the event in a late medieval manuscript belonging to the Bishop of Lambeth. 
[51.	A Miracle Play, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a town square full of people watching a performance on a temporary stage. A group of young musicians accompanies the action, which resembles a modern Nativity play. The buildings in the square are timbered, eaved houses with red roof tiles.
[52.	Shooting, Fowling and Fishing, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a rural landscape inhabited by a number of men engaged in various hunting activities. On the left there is a stone house, in which a woman sits embroidering on a frame. Outdoor activities involve fishing nets, crossbows, blow-pipes, rods, and birds of prey.
[53.	Winter in the Country, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a farm yard covered with snow. Figures trudge through the landscape, chop wood, and gather by the fire to keep warm. Livestock is shown huddled under cover or foraging for food. The image is an adaptation of an illumination in 'Les très riches heures du Duc de Berry' (1412-1416).
[54.	The Betrothal, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a number of people in an idealised rural landscape. From left, the figures include a fool in pink and black, the bridegroom holding out a ring, a male friend, a female friend, the bride holding out a ring, and two women gathering flowers. A house with neat kitchen garden stands on the right, and in the distance is a castle of pink stone with many turrets. The image is an adaptd version of a painting in 'Les très riches heures du Duc de Berry' (1412-1416).
[55.	Haymaking, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group of workers cutting hay in a fenced field, in front of a large pink castle with blue pointed turrets. Three men use scythes to cut the grass, which is gathered by two women with pitchforks. Elements of the image have probably been adapted from a European medieval Book of Hours.
[56.	Sheep-shearing and Reaping, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a rural scene. In the foreground, two men sit shearing sheep, while another watches. The other side of the fence, a field of corn is being harvested. In the distance is a walled town, a river, and a road leading to another town.
[57.	A Falconry Party, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group on horseback walking through a harvest-time countryside. The noblemen and women on the horses are accompanied by a page with falcons and birds. In the background, a wayfarer carries his children in a basket, and workers gather corn into bales. A group swims in a river on the right hand side. The image is an adaptation of an illumination in 'Les très riches heures du Duc de Berry' (1412-1416).
[58.	The Grape Harvest, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group of workers harvesting grapes in a vineyard. The landscape is dry and chalky, and in the distance stands a large fortified castle of light stone and blue tiles. The image adopts some motifs from an illumination in 'Les très riches heures du Duc de Berry' (1412-1416).
[59.	Harrowing and Sowing Corn, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a scene be the banks of a river. A farmer with two horses pulls a harrow through the ploughed earth, while another throws seed from his apron. Birds flock around, and a scarecrow dressed as an archer stands in the field. On the river, there are characters boating, walking and washing clothes. The image is an adaptation of an illumination in 'Les très riches heures du Duc de Berry' (1412-1416).
[60.	Feeding Pigs, 15th C.] Colour print with plain border, depicting a group of pigs in a small wood. They have been herded by a man who stands triumphantly with his dog. The landscape is hilly and a valley lake can be seen through the trees. The image is an adaptation of an illumination in 'Les très riches heures du Duc de Berry' (1412-1416).
[Box] Large red portfolio, opening at one end, with stapled sides. The inside of the flap features a paper label, listing all the images in the series.

fields.public_access_description: This set of History Class Pictures was produced by educational publishers Macmillan in 1951. It features sixty full colour illustrations, tracing Medieval history from the Norman invasion to the Renaissance. Drawn by a range of artists, the images make reference to famous paintings and prints, but reinterpreted in a bright and often humorous style meant to engage children. The grand narrative view they offer of history is punctuated by scenes of everyday life, of princes and peasants and work and play.
fields.bibliography:
Les Tres Riches Heures Du Duc de Berry, Limbourg Brothers, 1412-1416
Many of the illustrations in this series are modelled on miniatures from this medieval book of hours.
British Library 'Chroniques de France et d`Angleterre, Book II' Shelfmark Royal 18 E. I Netherlands, circa 1460-1480
Original source of the image
fields.history_note: The two sets of History Class Pictures (B.401 and 402-2012) were found in Ralph Munn's loft when he died in 1995. Munns was a history teacher in the early 1960s, and he used these pictures to teach junior aged children.
